str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sun and doulos; a co-slave, i.e. Servitor or ministrant of the same master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
